first of all you have to use the bread flour to get the maximum volume. Second of all folding is only meaningful when the butter and dough is laminated seperately. if youre mixing the butter into the dough its more like brioche not croissant. However many people try to avoid this step. The reason why gemmas croissant didnt have the distinctive layers that we find in parisienne croissants is because of what I have explained. when they are baked the dough and the butter will eventually fuse. I bet if you made her recipe without failure you could go try and make the authentic croissant recipe. Check out his recipe too ! bruno albouze on youtube. -- A lot of people are asking if they can use margarine instead of butter.  I don't know which brand of butter Gemna uses, but if there's ever a time you want to splurge and spend little more to buy butter, it's when making croissants!  Of course, if you just want to use margarine you could, but what's the point!! It will still be bread, but it's NOT going to be the same great tasting, high quality croissant you're expecting!!!  As she said, making these is a labor of love, but definitely worth it! So if you're going to the trouble of making these, it would be better to use butter this time!
